structure.unit: PAYMENT, COLLECTION, AND REFUND OF TAXES

law.catch_line: County clerk to collect ad valorem taxes on motor vehicles registered by him -- Acceptable means of payment.
law.text: The county clerk shall be collector of all state, county, city, urban-county government, school, and special taxing district ad valorem taxes on motor vehicles registered by him. The clerk may accept payment of taxes due by any commercially acceptable means including credit cards.
law.history: Amended 1998 Ky. Acts ch. 209, sec. 17, effective March 30, 1998. -- Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 431, sec. 1, effective July 15, 1986. -- Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 264, sec. 7, effective January 1, 1984.
